title: Script used for credits in Small Pleasures (2008) movie on YouTube
content:
found this in some credits genius little film!!!

[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=flkFW5E0XcM](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=flkFW5E0XcM)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fffont_4877.jpg)
author: mikehedge

comments.content:
Lombriz is close but not exact match:  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000171](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000171 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000171")
thanks. I love the "S" in his credits... maybe he will write me back. thanks for your effort =)

I agree with DesignGuy as far as looking like a Sudtipos/Ale Paul font, although I would have picked some of the following as being more similar: [Affair](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000181), [Buffet Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000213), [Ministry Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000149) and [La Portenia](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000105). All of these had a very similar feeling, but details weren't the same. I wonder if this used alternates from one of the fonts I mentioned. At least the test drives chose different letterforms.

- Mike Yanega

ah so close... I have messaged the filmmaker directly.

his main logo I think is the same font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202091627im_/http:/typophile.com/files/teller_4813.jpg)

I like the "r" and the "s"

thanks for your guy's help!

Mike
